intro: Linum dichotomum, commonly known as the two-branched flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassy areas or along roadsides. Linum dichotomum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
